name: PutFeature
label: put feature
definition: redemption provision giving the holder the right, but not the obligation, to sell a specified amount of the debt instrument (i.e., redeem it), prior to maturity

name: CallFeature
definition: redemption provision defining the rights of the issuer to buy back a security at a call price after a call protection period
label: call feature
explanatoryNote: Most corporate and municipal bonds have ten-year call features (termed call protection by holders); government securities typically have none.

name: FullyIndexedInterestRate
label: fully-indexed interest rate
definition: a variable interest rate that is calculated by adding a margin to a specified index rate
explanatoryNote: Fully indexed interest rates are used for variable rate credit products. The interest rate on a variable (adjustable) rate mortgage corresponds to a specific benchmark (often the prime rate, but sometimes LIBOR, the one-year constant-maturity Treasury, or other benchmarks) plus a spread (also called the margin. The margin on a fully indexed interest rate product is determined by the underwriter and based on the borrower's credit quality.

name: FixedIncomeSecurity
definition: tradeable debt instrument that provides a return in the form of fixed periodic payments and typically the return of principal at maturity
label: fixed income security
explanatoryNote: Fixed income securities provide payments according to a regular schedule. This does not necessarily mean that the payments themselves are of a fixed amount, however.

name: TradableDebtInstrument
explanatoryNote: Details from Ecofin: A [debt] instrument can be traded, if its features depend only on one borrower. If the instrument has no bilateral or multilateral obligations, the investor can easily transfer it to another investor without asking the borrower (except the terms prohibit this explicitly). This is simplified with securitised instruments, where the debt is already split into handy denominations which trade easily (e.g. in round thousands or millions as with bonds, commercial paper, etc.). But in principle it works also with interbank loans and similar instruments. FIBIM Definition: Financial instruments evidencing moneys owed by the issuer to the holder on terms as specified.
label: tradable debt instrument
definition: a debt instrument that is also a security, i.e., that can be bought and sold by the holder

name: MakeWholeFeature
label: make whole feature
explanatoryNote: The issuer typically has to make a lump sum payment to the investor derived from a formula based on the net present value (NPV) of future interest or coupon payments that will not be paid incrementally because of the call combined with the principal payment the investor would have received at maturity.
definition: a call provision allowing the issuer to pay off remaining debt early

name: VariableIncomeSecurity
definition: tradeable debt instrument that provide their owners with a rate of return that is dynamic and determined by market forces
label: variable income security
explanatoryNote: Variable-income securities provide investors with both greater risks as well as rewards.

name: Margin
definition: a variable that is added to a specified index rate to determine the fully indexed interest rate charged to a borrower on a credit balance
label: margin

name: PutSchedule
definition: a schedule that defines the events associated with the put feature of a debt instrument, i.e, the dates on which the debt instrument may be sold at what price by the holder
label: put schedule

name: PutWindow
definition: an explicit period of time prior to a put date during which holder or agent must give notice to an issuer
label: put window

name: NotificationProvision
label: notification provision
definition: provision of a redemption feature defining notification requirements

name: NonTradableDebtInstrument
definition: a debt instrument that may not be bought or sold
label: non-tradable debt instrument
explanatoryNote: Generally, a nonnegotiable instrument may be redeemed by the issuer, but this is often subject to some limitations.

name: CallWindow
label: call window
definition: an explicit period of time prior to a call date during which an issuer or agent must give notice to holders

name: PutEvent
label: put event
definition: an event associated with the put schedule for a debt instrument, i.e., an event involving the 'put', or surrender of the instrument by the holder

name: RedemptionEvent
label: redemption event
definition: a prescriptive event involving the return of an investor's principal in a fixed-income security, such as a preferred stock or bond, or the sale of units in a mutual fund

name: Strip
label: strip
explanatoryNote: STRIPS is an acronym for Separate Trading of Registered Interest and Principal of Securities, which has come to be used as a term in its own right.
definition: a tradeable debt instrument created either through the process of removing coupons from a bond and then selling the separate parts as a zero coupon bond and an interest paying coupon bond or through taking the opposite position from some variant in the options market

name: InterestOnlyStrip
definition: a strip that represents the non-principal portion of the monthly payments on the underlying debt instrument, such as a bond
explanatoryNote: An interest-only strip holder is interested in rising rates and no prepayment, as prepayment would cause them forfeit future interest payments and receive nothing from the return of the principal.
label: interest-only strip

name: PubliclyIssuedDebt
label: publicly issued debt
definition: an issued debt in the form of a tradable debt instrument (security)

name: IssuedDebt
label: issued debt
definition: debt that is set out by the borrower in some form of financial security in which the lender is the holder or counterparty of that security

name: CallSchedule
definition: a schedule of call prices and when they are in effect
label: call schedule

name: PrescriptiveEvent
label: prescriptive event
definition: event related to the imposition or enforcement of a rule, method, formula, etc.

name: DebtOffering
label: debt offering
definition: an offering of one or more debt instruments for sale

name: StepSchedule
label: step schedule
definition: schedule specifying the date(s) and change in a contractual term(s), e.g., rate or notional amount, for a contract that has a feature where stipulated changes occur at specified intervals or on specified dates

name: PutNotificationProvision
definition: a provision of a put feature defining notification requirements
label: put notification provision

name: PrincipalOnlyStrip
definition: a strip that represents the principal portion of the monthly payments on the underlying debt instrument, such as a bond
label: principal-only strip

name: RelativePrice
definition: security price specified in comparison with either a stated or market value for a debt instrument at some point in time
label: relative price

name: CallPremium
label: call premium
definition: the price over par paid by an issuer to redeem securities when exercising a call provision

name: StepEvent
label: step event
definition: event that prescribes a change in a contractual term, such as a rate or notional amount, for a given contract

name: CallEvent
definition: an event associated with the call schedule for a debt instrument
label: call event

name: CallNotificationProvision
definition: provision of a call feature defining notification requirements
label: call notification provision

name: PutPremium
definition: an amount over par that a debt instrument holder must pay to sell the security early
label: put premium

name: ParValue
label: par value
definition: the stated value of a negotiable instrument, stock, or bond, as compared with the value that instrument might receive when sold

name: isExtendableByIssuer
definition: indicates whether the issuer has the option to extend the debt rather than refinancing
label: is extendable by issuer
explanatoryNote: If not, the issuer may only refinance the debt by calling the issue and creating a new issue.

name: hasInterestPaymentTerms
definition: indicates the specific terms related to interest payments on the principal as specified in the instrument or a related contract document
label: has interest payment terms

name: isExchangeable
definition: indicates whether the security can be exchanged for another security at the issuers discretion
label: is exchangeable

name: hasRightToRetain
label: right to retain
definition: indicates whether the holder has an option to retain the security in the event of an issuer exercising the put feature

name: hasDefaultLotSize
definition: indicates the default number of units of the security that may be held at any one time
explanatoryNote: This is the minimum denomination required for transfer or change of ownership of a tradable debt security.
label: has default lot size

name: hasRelativePriceAtMaturity
definition: indicates a relative price with respect to the face value at the time an instrument matures, namely par, discount or premium
label: has relative price at maturity

name: isPutable
definition: indicates whether the holder has the right to ask for redemption of the security prior to final maturity
label: is putable

name: allowsPaymentInKind
label: allows payment in kind
definition: indicates whether the principal may be repaid in kind (i.e., replaced with another instrument) rather than in cash

name: isSubordinatedTo
definition: indicates the target security (i.e., the one in the range) has a higher priority than the security in question
label: is subordinated to

name: isExtendableByHolder
label: is extendable by holder
definition: indicates whether the expiration date or maturity date can be extended by the holder

name: hasRepaymentTerms
label: has repayment terms
definition: indicates the specific terms related to repayment of principal as specified in the instrument or a related contract document

name: hasDatedDate
explanatoryNote: Investors who purchase a fixed-income security between interest payment dates must also pay the seller or issuer any interest that has accrued from the dated date to the purchase date, or settlement date, in addition to the face value.
label: has dated date
definition: specifies the date on which interest begins to accrue on a fixed-income security

name: isCallable
definition: indicates whether the issuer (writer) of the debt contract (the debtor) can call the debt prior to maturity
label: is callable

name: isStrippable
label: is strippable
definition: indicates whether or not the instrument can be stripped, so that interest and principal may be traded separately

name: AtAPremium
definition: a selling price significantly above the stated face or redemption value due to high demand or timing of redemption
label: at a premium

name: hasNotificationProvision
definition: relates the redemption provision of a debt instrument to a notification provision (e.g., call or put notification)
label: has notification provision

name: hasEstateOrDeathPutFeature
label: has estate or death put feature
definition: indicates that a security is subject to redemption upon the passing of the holder

name: hasPutFeature
label: has put feature
definition: indicates the specific terms related to any inherent put feature as specified in the offering/instrument

name: hasPriceAndYieldDayCountConvention
label: has price and yield day count convention
definition: indicates the convention used to determine the number of days in a month and days in a year that are counted when performing calculations for yield and price figures

name: isSubordinated
definition: indicates whether the security is a subordinated security, meaning that the security has a lower priority than another security so that when the assets are liquidated this one is not first in line
label: is subordinated

name: AtADiscount
definition: a selling price that is less than the face or nominal value
label: at a discount

name: hasCallFeature
definition: indicates the specific terms related to any inherent call feature as specified in the offering/instrument
label: has call feature

name: hasRelativePriceAtRedemption
label: has relative price at redemption
definition: indicates a relative price with respect to the face value at the time an instrument is redeemed, namely par, discount or premium

name: hasRelativePriceAtIssue
definition: indicates a relative price with respect to the face value at which an instrument is issued, namely par, premium or discount
label: has relative price at issue

name: hasPoolNumber
definition: indicates the pool number of the debt
label: has pool number

name: allowsAutoReinvestment
label: allows auto-reinvestment
definition: indicates whether the security allows automatically re-investing the interest on that security towards purchasing additional shares or units of the same security
